Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\validators\FileValidator

All Classes | Properties | Methods
Inheritanceyii\validators\FileValidator » yii\validators\Validator » yii\base\Component » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable
Subclassesyii\validators\ImageValidator
Available since version2.0
Source Code
FileValidator verifies if an attribute is receiving a valid uploaded file.

Hide inherited properties

Protected Methods

Hide inherited methods

MethodDescriptionDefined By
validateValue() yii\validators\FileValidator

Property Details

$message property
string $message = null

The error message used when a file is not uploaded correctly.

$types property
array|string $types = null

A list of file name extensions that are allowed to be uploaded. This can be either an array or a string consisting of file extension names separated by space or comma (e.g. "gif, jpg"). Extension names are case-insensitive. Defaults to null, meaning all file name extensions are allowed.

See Also

  • $wrongType
$minSize property
integer $minSize = null

The minimum number of bytes required for the uploaded file. Defaults to null, meaning no limit.

See Also

  • $tooSmall
$maxSize property
integer $maxSize = null

The maximum number of bytes required for the uploaded file. Defaults to null, meaning no limit. Note, the size limit is also affected by 'upload_max_filesize' INI setting and the 'MAX_FILE_SIZE' hidden field value.

See Also

  • $tooBig
$maxFiles property
integer $maxFiles = 1

The maximum file count the given attribute can hold. It defaults to 1, meaning single file upload. By defining a higher number, multiple uploads become possible.

See Also

  • $tooMany
$uploadRequired property
string $uploadRequired = null

The error message used when no file is uploaded.

$tooBig property
string $tooBig = null

The error message used when the uploaded file is too large. You may use the following tokens in the message: - {attribute}: the attribute name - {file}: the uploaded file name - {limit}: the maximum size allowed (see getSizeLimit())

$tooSmall property
string $tooSmall = null

The error message used when the uploaded file is too small. You may use the following tokens in the message: - {attribute}: the attribute name - {file}: the uploaded file name - {limit}: the value of $minSize

$wrongType property
string $wrongType = null

The error message used when the uploaded file has an extension name that is not listed in $types. You may use the following tokens in the message: - {attribute}: the attribute name - {file}: the uploaded file name - {extensions}: the list of the allowed extensions.

$tooMany property
string $tooMany = null

The error message used if the count of multiple uploads exceeds limit. You may use the following tokens in the message: - {attribute}: the attribute name - {limit}: the value of $maxFiles

$behaviors property read-only
yii\base\Behavior[] getBehaviors( )

list of behaviors attached to this component

$sizeLimit property read-only
integer getSizeLimit( )

the size limit for uploaded files.

Method Details

init() method
void init( )

validateAttribute() method
void validateAttribute( $object, $attribute )
$object
$attribute

validateValue() method
void validateValue( $file )
$file

getSizeLimit() method
integer getSizeLimit( )
return integer the size limit for uploaded files.

Returns the maximum size allowed for uploaded files.

This is determined based on three factors:

  • 'upload_max_filesize' in php.ini
  • 'MAX_FILE_SIZE' hidden field
  • $maxSize
